_header: All that the prophets told while in their prophecy
Bibliographic Ghosts: Cambridge UK, St John’s College B.6 (28), f. 25: see 3452
_description: Lines on the Prophets, used in the South English Legendary as prologue or headlink to a number of legends (4196, 3452, 6380, and 6690) — four or five lines in couplets

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
All þat þe prophetes tolden whylen in heore prophecieAl
                    was of vr lord crist and of his Modur Marie…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Dauid and Daniel and þe holy IeremyeAnd alle þis
                    oþere goode men and þe holy zakarie
BodEngPoeta1.Note:
As headlink to the Prologue of the Founding of the Feast of the
                    Conception (6690)
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodRawPoe225.Transcription:
In olde time prophetes tolde in hir prophecyeAl was of any [
                    ]…
BodRawPoe225.Note:
As headlink to Prologue to the ‘Long Life of Christ’ (6380); page damaged by damp, such
                    that ink faded and virtually unreadable in places.

In olde time prophetes tolde in hir prophecyeAl was of any [
                    ]…
CamTCC605.Note: As headlink to the ‘Long Life of Christ’ (6380).

Digital Facsimile of Trinity College Cambridge MS R.3.25.

BLEge1993.Transcription: Þe prophetes tolden while in here prophecieAl it was of oure lord and of is moder marieBoþe abraham & moises ionas and elieElise and abacuc & þe wise ysaieDauid and daniel & þe holi ieremie
BLEge1993.Note: As Prologue to the ‘Short Life of Christ’ (4196).

BLSto949.First Lines: Pes nou pes among vs be ȝe godemen alle & someHerkneþ one wyle to me ȝe þat beþ hider icome…
BLSto949.Last Lines: …Boþe Moyses & Abraham Ionas and helyȝeDauyd & Danyel & þe holy Ieremyȝe
BLSto949.Note: Six lines written on one side of a fragment bound into the MS between full-sized folios 88 and 90, with catchword “Whon men heren” to indicate placement before Prologue to the “Long Life of Christ” (6380).

NLS1921.Transcription:
Al þat þe prophetes schewed whilom In her prophecieAl it
                    was of our lord & of his moder marieBoþe moyses and abraham Jonas
                    & helyeDauid & daniel & þe holy geromie
NLS1921.Note:
As headlink to Prologue to the ‘Long Life of Christ’ (6380); couplets written half line
                    of verse per line of manuscript.

Lam223.First Lines:
PEs now amonges vs gode men all & someHerkenes a whyle to me
                    ȝe þat ben hider comeÞat þe prophetes tolden som tyme
                    in her prophecye…
Lam223.Last Lines:
…Boþe Moyses & Abraham Ionas and ElyeDauid and Daniel
                    and þe holy Ieremy
Lam223.Note: As headlink to Prologue to the ‘Long Life of Christ’ (6380).
